purpose.to_describe: the metadata and form of a NetCDF-format file

abbrev_widget_len.description: an arbitrary example of a data variable

xxxxx_Group_Attributes.group: can omit/empty, xxxxx is group name

summary.value: Based on 'prepped' PREFIRE Level-0 payload and bus telemetry data files, this file contains categorized types of all input science packet data frames, and will not be archived at a DAAC.

ctime.long_name: continuous_time at the science packet frame end
ctime.description: similar to TAI, referenced to the epoch 2000-01-01T00:00:00 UTC, and valid at the end of the frame (i.e., end of TIRS image integration)

scipkt_frame_type.description: the determined frame type category for each calibration-input science data frame. For SAT1 this is primarily based on data other than motor encoder values, while for SAT2, this is primarily based on on motor encoder values
scipkt_frame_type.flag_meanings: [0] nominal obstgt, [1] possible obstgt, [10] nominal caltgt (cal-sequence), [11] possible caltgt, [12] nominal caltgt (non-cal-sequence), [13] possible caltgt (payload-on-but-safed), [20] nominal space (cal-sequence), [21] possible space, [22] nominal space (non-cal-sequence), [30] skew based on encoder only, [31] skew based on block frame count 1, [32] skew based on block frame count 2, [33] skew based on encoder + ROIC DN, [34] skew assumed via disposition, [40] hard stop (motor power off), [41] hard stop (motor power-level sentinel), [42] space aperture short scan

scipkt_bus_status_bitflags.description: integer composed of bit flags that contain boolean info about bus status for each calibration-input science data frame
scipkt_bus_status_bitflags.value_meaning: [b0] REFS_ESM is invalid?, [b1] ATT_DET is invalid?, [b2] REFS is invalid?, [b3] bus telemetry gap?, [4] spacecraft payload is powered off?

scipkt_bus_events_bitflags.description: integer composed of bit flags that contain boolean info about bus events for each calibration-input science data frame
scipkt_bus_events_bitflags.value_meaning: [b0] ascending pass?, [b1] within moon umbra (eclipse)?, [b2] within Earth umbra (eclipse)?, [b3] radio is transmitting?, [b4] radio is active (rx or tx)?, [b5] within payload-on-but-safed (staring at internal cal target) bus maneuver period (start of bus_macro_44 motor hard stop (MHS) to start of bus_macro_45 MHS)?, [b6] bus slew (unknown)?, [b7] bus slew to radio-contact attitude?, [b8] bus slew to LVLH attitude?, [b9] bus slew to safe attitude?, [b10] bus slew to GPS-zenith-point attitude?, [b11] bus slew due to modeled sun avoidance (MSA)?

mirror_aostart_ctime.description: within the calibration-input science data frame time-series, continuous_time at which the corresponding mirror angular offset value is first valid; similar to TAI, and referenced to the epoch 2000-01-01T00:00:00 UTC

mirror_ang_offset.description: within the calibration-input science data frame time-series, the time-dependent component of the angular offset of the pointing mirror (with respect to the nadir aperture boresight)
